page.title: 08THE GREEN AT CROXLEY
page.content: THE GREEN AT CROXLEY IS VERY LONG AND USED TO BE SURROUNDED BY FARMS. TODAY ONLY ONE OF THESE FARMS STILL EXISTS, ALTHOUGH MANY OF THE OLD FARM HOUSES ARE STILL THERE.SOME OF THE PRESENT OCCUPANTS STILL HAVE COMMONER'S RIGHTS OVER THE GREEN.AT THE NORTHERN END OF THE GREEN IS CROXLEY HOUSE, BUILT IN 1770,AND ONCE THE HOME OF LORD HYDE.IT IS NOW AN OLD PEOPLE'S HOME RUN BY THE WRVS.AT THE SOUTHERN END IS ALL SAINTS CHURCH,BUILT IN 1870 TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE GROWING POPULATION OF CROXLEY.ON THE GREEN COMMEMORATIVE TREES HAVE BEEN PLANTED.THE OLDEST IS THE QUEEN VICTORIA DIAMOND JUBILEE OAK PLANTED IN 1897.THE LATEST IS THE TREE PLANTED TO COMMEMORATE THE SILVER JUBILEE OF QUEEN ELIZABETH.THE OLDEST COTTAGE IS PROVIDENCE HALL,THOUGHT TO BE ABOUT 350 YEARS OLD.THE GREEN IS NOW A CONSERVATION AREA.
